treatments.title: Treatment Methods
treatments.description: We offer various Chinese medicine treatments, including concentrated herbal granules, acupuncture, integrated structural therapy, and various specialized therapies.

decoction.name: Concentrated Herbal Granules
decoction.description: Concentrated Chinese herbal granules are granules or powders made by extracting and concentrating traditional Chinese herbs using modern technology, offering convenience in use and storage. The production involves selecting herbs, decocting, concentrating, and drying, preserving the active ingredients with efficacy comparable to traditional decoctions. Simply dissolve in warm water for consumption, eliminating the hassle of self-decoction, ideal for busy modern lifestyles. These granules are widely used for health regulation and chronic disease treatment, featuring precise dosage, portability, and quick absorption, making them popular among patients.
decoction.symptoms: Internal medicine conditions such as colds, fevers, coughs, and stomach pains, as well as for body conditioning and immune enhancement.

acupuncture.name: Acupuncture
acupuncture.description: Acupuncture is the core technique of Chinese medicine, originating from traditional practices, involving the insertion of fine needles into specific acupoints to regulate qi and blood flow and balance yin and yang. Acupuncture stimulates these points, promotes blood circulation, relieves pain, and regulates organ functions. It's commonly used to treat chronic pain, digestive issues, and insomnia. During treatment, professional practitioners select appropriate points based on individual conditions, ensuring safety and effectiveness. This simple procedure has minimal side effects and, supported by modern medical research, has proven effective for various conditions, gaining worldwide trust as a natural therapeutic method.
acupuncture.symptoms: Various conditions including pain, headaches, insomnia, and anxiety.

moxibustion.name: Moxibustion
moxibustion.description: Moxibustion is a traditional Chinese therapy using burning moxa sticks or cones made from mugwort to apply heat to specific acupoints, warming the meridians and regulating qi and blood flow. It promotes blood circulation and enhances immunity, effectively treating joint pain from cold-damp conditions, gynecological issues, and fatigue. Practitioners carefully control the distance and duration for safety and comfort. This gentle, non-invasive therapy has few side effects and, combined with mugwort's medicinal properties, is particularly suitable for those with cold constitutions. As a natural therapy, moxibustion is globally popular for its warming and therapeutic effects.
moxibustion.symptoms: Cold stomach, lower back pain, joint pain, and various symptoms caused by cold-damp conditions or cold constitution.

structural.name: Integrated Structural Therapy
structural.description:
The body is supported by its skeletal framework, which relies on muscles and fascia for proper alignment. When muscles are injured or overused, adhesions form between muscles and fascia, preventing normal interaction and leading to skeletal misalignment. This affects local fluid circulation due to pressure changes, resulting in various forms of edema and inflammation.

Many bodily discomforts stem from hardware issues affecting functionality. These impacts can manifest as limb pain or internal organ compression causing symptoms like stomach pain or dizziness.

Structural therapy fundamentally releases adhesions at different levels, allowing proper bone realignment to resolve various issues.

Our approach mainly guide the body through gentle movements or assist with needling to release muscle tension and restore normal function.
structural.symptoms: Spinal issues, muscle pain, postural problems, or any internal medicine symptoms caused by structural issues.

therapy.name: Chinese Medicine Physiotherapy
therapy.description: Chinese medicine physiotherapy includes traditional treatments like cupping and gua sha, aimed at regulating qi-blood and clearing meridians. Cupping uses negative pressure to adhere to the skin, promoting blood circulation and relieving muscle pain and cold symptoms, particularly effective for shoulder and neck stiffness. Gua sha involves scraping the skin with special tools to remove dampness, improve fatigue and circulation, suitable for fever or musculoskeletal discomfort. These simple, professional treatments are safe, effective, with minimal side effects. Combined with Traditional Chinese Medicine theory, these methods regulate constitution and boost immunity, popular among health enthusiasts.
therapy.symptoms: Various chronic pain conditions and muscle tension.
